fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • A feature about the use of British character actors in Hollywood films (Yes, we serve oddballs, 8 December, page 16, G2) included Michael Fassbender among their number. Fassbender is Irish-German – he was born in Heidelberg to an Irish mother and a German father, and grew up in Killarney before moving to London to attend drama school. He does often play characters with British accents, including the android in Prometheus that the feature referred to as one of a number of “British robots in fantasy cinema”. • An article (Systemic doping is not limited to Russia, says Wada chief investigator, 9 December, page 1, Sport) used the word “coruscating” to describe a report published in July that accused Russia’s government, security services and sporting authorities of colluding to hide widespread doping in sport. We meant excoriating (censuring severely), not coruscating (sparkling or emitting flashes of light).
